dialog: P1:It's a murder now, huh. And I thought it was a suicide.
P2:A murder? How interesting.
P1:I thought that we'd get to skip work because of the investigation, but apparently students on-campus aren't notified yet.
P1:I guess they don't want to blow the news on them just yet.
P2:Hah. Yet another thing to crush their hopes and dreams.
SELF:...
P1:Dude. Calm down! What's with you?!
P1:Oh. We didn't set them up. Security did.
P1:We kinda hacked into the system to monitor the lab. We were getting reports on stolen equipment, and wanted to get to the bottom of it.
SELF:There was a jump-cut in the footage.
P1:Maybe it's a glitch in the system?
P2:For security purposes, data recorded is not stored.
P1:This is interesting. We will look into that when everything dies down.
SELF:Pretty high-end stuff, alright.
P1:Yup. A professor is currently teaching a course on graphics and games - we were told to upgrade them. The students seem happy.
P2:One time I passed by, they were yelling their heads off.
P1:Looks like someone finally finished that project.
P2:Bug-free.
P1:Hopefully.
SELF:Can I take a look inside?
P1:Sure.... Here's a screwdriver, but why...
SELF:What's that green stuff? A small wad of it is stuck to the edge of the casing.
P1:I don't know
SELF:Smells like weed.
SELF:Hello? Hello?
SELF:...
SELF:They hung up.
SELF:...
SELF:Why is it in camera mode?
SELF:Ugliest couch ever.
SELF:It looks absolutely horrible, and doesn't even seem comfortable.
SELF:The thing is caked with dust - how long has it been sitting there?
SELF:Absolutely disgusting.
SELF:Shelves are caked with dust. Apparently, no one saw fit to put stuff on it.
SELF:Looks like students aren't too keen on reading, if they are busy playing games.
SELF:Great to know that this school is big on literature.
P1:We used to have books. Then people started taking them.
P1:We didn't have any security cameras installed, so we didn't know who did it.
P2:We eventually just grabbed the books and shoved them in the school library, to avoid losses, you know.
SELF:Cubbies caked with dust.
P1:Once upon a time, we had an electronics class that had stuff stored in there.
P2:Now, we don't.
SELF:Pretty good security.
P2:Very thick doors. Good at keeping people out and the fires in.
P2:Or the other way around.
SELF:It's unlocked.
P1:That door leads to a private research room.
